meanings.definition: The act of engaging in an activity for amusement rather than serious interest or expertise.
meanings.sent1: Her dilettantism in painting led to colorful but amateurish artworks.
meanings.sent2: His dilettantism in music meant he played different instruments without mastering any.
meanings.sent3: The dilettantism in gardening resulted in a chaotic mix of flowers and vegetables.
meanings.sent4: His dilettantism in cooking was like a wild dance of flavors in the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The dilettantism in photography captured moments with a playful touch.

meanings.definition: A person who dabbles in various activities without serious commitment or expertise.
meanings.sent1: She was known as a dilettantism, trying out different hobbies every week.
meanings.sent2: The dilettantism was seen at the art fair, exploring pottery, painting, and sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The dilettantism at the gym tried yoga, weightlifting, and Zumba in one day.
meanings.sent4: His dilettantism in sports made him a jack-of-all-trades but master of none.
meanings.sent5: The dilettantism in literature read a bit of every genre, never settling on one.
